posts.post_content: Almost strictly better than, say, [Ivy Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ivy Elemental); people are used to things like [Feral Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Feral Hydra) or [Protean Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Protean Hydra), though, so this seems a bit vanilla in comparison. Still a nice card, though.

posts.post_content: With [Essence of the Wild](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Essence of the Wild) out, you can repeatably make 6/6s for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol). Note that these will stay copies of EotW even if the original is killed, but will enter as 0/0s if your only EotW is killed in response. [Sprout Swarm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sprout Swarm), on the other hand, makes them for 5 with convoke at instant speed.
posts.html:
With Essence of the Wild out, you can repeatably make 6/6s for . Note that these will stay copies of EotW even if the original is killed, but will enter as 0/0s if your only EotW is killed in response. Sprout Swarm, on the other hand, makes them for 5 with convoke at instant speed.

Posted By: kiseki (3/19/2012 4:50:23 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
2GG + X for an X/X every turn is fairly friggin solid in mono green.  
  
With a half decent hand in a deck built for effects like this you can be cranking out at least a 4/4 every turn starting on turn 3.   
  
Most of the time though, I'd prefer to draw this turn 5+. Works wicked with [Garruk's Packleader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk's Packleader) though. That has won me more than a few counter-top games.
posts.html:
2GG + X for an X/X every turn is fairly friggin solid in mono green.

With a half decent hand in a deck built for effects like this you can be cranking out at least a 4/4 every turn starting on turn 3.

Most of the time though, I'd prefer to draw this turn 5+. Works wicked with Garruk's Packleader though. That has won me more than a few counter-top games.

posts.post_content: Interestingly enough, in an EDH game I realized that, with [Fecundity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fecundity) on the battlefield this card also gains what I like to call cycling buyback for {2}{G}{G} (cast Wurmcalling for {G} with buyback cost of {2}{G}, the 0/0 wurm token enters the battlefield and then goes to graveyard, allowing you to draw a card)
